trans-unit.source: Defines the metadata attribute that Web server controls and their members use to indicate whether their rendering can be affected by themes and control skins.
This class cannot be inherited.
Control developers use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> attribute to decorate control types and their members, to signal which ones can and cannot be affected by themes and control skins.
By default, all properties exposed by a control are themeable.
However, themes are typically applied only to stylistic properties; the `Themeable(false)` attribute should be applied explicitly to all non-stylistic properties.
Decorating a member with the `Themeable(false)` attribute ensures that the member is not themed, regardless of the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.EnableTheming%2A> property.

For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> attribute is applied to a control and set to `false`, the control is not affected by themes even when its <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.EnableTheming%2A> property is set to `true`.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> class maintains a static list of all types that support themes, and this list is consulted whenever the static methods <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.IsObjectThemeable%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.IsTypeThemeable%2A> are called.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> class, using the specified Boolean value to determine whether the attribute represents a type or member that is affected by themes and control skins.

Passing `true` to this constructor is equivalent to using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.Yes> field, while passing `false` is equivalent to using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.No> field.
`true` to initialize the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> to represent a type or member that can be affected by themes; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> instance that represents the application-defined default value of the attribute.
The default value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> class is equivalent to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.Yes> field.
This is not necessarily equivalent to an instance that is created using the default class constructor.
Returns a value that indicates whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
An `object` to compare with this instance, or `null`.
`true` if obj is the same instance as the current instance, or if the instances are different, but the attribute values are equivalent; otherwise, `false`.
Serves as a hash function for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> type.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.GetHashCode%2A> method is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref>.

Gets a value indicating whether the current instance is equivalent to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.Default"></xref> instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> class.
`true` if the current instance is equivalent to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.Default"></xref> instance of the class; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the object passed to the method supports themes.
The object to test for themes support.
`true` if the object supports themes and control skins; otherwise, `false`.
The instance parameter is `null`.
Returns a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> passed to the method supports themes.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> class maintains a static internal catalog of types that support themes, and this method checks the catalog to determine whether the specified <xref:System.Type> is represented there.

If it is not, the method examines the <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> object associated with the <xref:System.Type> for the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> attribute to determine whether themes are supported.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to test for themes support.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> supports themes and control skins; otherwise, `false`.
The type parameter is `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> instance used to decorate a type or member that is not affected by themes and control skins.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.No> field is equivalent to creating an instance using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.%23ctor%28System.Boolean%29> constructor and passing `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the current control or member of a control can be affected by themes and control skins defined for the Web application.
A member is affected by themes if no <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> attribute is defined explicitly for the member, or the `Themeable(true)` attribute is applied.
A member is not affected by themes if the `Themeable(false)` attribute is applied; this is the default value for <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute>.
`true` if the current type or member can be affected by themes; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> instance used to decorate a type or member that is affected by themes and control skins.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.Yes> field is equivalent to creating an instance using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute.%23ctor%28System.Boolean%29> constructor and passing `true`.
